website_summaries.verdict: These bars are flavorful, easy to include in survival kits or use as a meal replacement when camping and hiking.
pros: These flavorful bars offer 400 calories of balanced nutrition and a 5-year shelf life
Individually wrapped, these bars are easy carry, they do not promote thirst, and each bar provides the recommended daily allowance of vitamins and minerals to sustain energy
cons: Lower in calories than most emergency ration bars, these bars are great for children, but do not provide enough calories to sustain energy in adults

customer_reviews.title: Bought It To Test
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to test out the flavor and the claims that it doesn't make the consumer thirsty. The flavor is a strong but pleasant lemon flavor and it did not make me thirsty. The way it is scored makes it easy to count calories consumed. I will buy more of this item in the future. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay, am I really eating a ration?
customer_reviews.text: This tastes like a lemon cake. It is sweet to the point that I feel like I'm eating half-cooked lemon cake dough. This is verging on snack material, seriously. The only drawback is the lack of a resealable package; not that the ration sections would last long enough to go bad anyway (most other rations take some encouragement to eat, not so much with these). Also, not at all thirst provoking. Highly recommended if your down for almost soft, lemon cake-y sweetness. Not so much if your looking for bland-pressed crumble-cake though, as there's none of that here.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony C.

customer_reviews.title: Taste is tolerable, filling, light, and compact
customer_reviews.text: This isn't something you'd take solely as food for camping or whatnot, but it's a perfectly good emergency ration. The taste is slightly citrusy on top of a shortbread flavor; very tolerable. I may get some more later to see what they'd be like topped or crumbled into like jam packets or something. I could see these being useful for camping as a dietary supplement; I think one could do well to crumble one into some mixed veggies and dried meat to make a soup, for instance.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: these are my favorite emergency rations
customer_reviews.text: So far, these are my favorite emergency rations. My ONLY complaint (i.e. the one thing that kept me from giving it a full five stars) is that none of their packages have resealable packs like the ER emergency brand. (To remedy this, I always add a piece of gaffer or duct tape to every pack of Mainstay that I have.) For the record, I would eat this any day over hardtack. I can only hope that someday Mainstay creates other palatable flavors...
customer_reviews.author: Moses Domingo

customer_reviews.title: Taste like a very dense cookie
customer_reviews.text: Taste like a very dense cookie. Not as dry as I was expecting, and was pleasantly surprised. Used as a suppliment on a 50 Mile hike/backpacking excusion.
customer_reviews.author: john erley

customer_reviews.title: Doable
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers I found the product pleasant enough and did not make me thirsty. This is definately a good last resort food source. Haven't tried other products yet but this did taste like a lemon sandies cookie but not as sweet. I will keep some of these for a bug-out bag supply. Fast ship and packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: CS Frost

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent taste and healthier than the rest
customer_reviews.text: The taste was not that bad: like a half baked lemon flavored sandies cookie. Does crumble but not as much as you think. It was the healthier of all of the emergency ration bar I have seen. I ordered a few to keep in the cupboard when stuff hits the fan since it last 5 years and it does not make you thirsty.
customer_reviews.author: L. Jones

customer_reviews.title: main stay bar
customer_reviews.text: Main stay makes a great product. Always well packaged and a necessity for anyone in natural disater prone areas, hikers, and survivalist. Lightweight and easily stored. I prefer the 1200 calorie bars for my self because i dont have to keep all the bars safe once I open the package.
customer_reviews.author: Marine Scout

customer_reviews.title: great to have
customer_reviews.text: great to have, put one in every EDC and Get Home bag I have. Do not taste bad, not affected by temperature
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Product is pretty good. I am impressed by the quality. TASTE GREAT... Arrived on time, the packaging was good. Will buy another, and I will recommend to others...
customer_reviews.author: NEESA

customer_reviews.title: very good!!
customer_reviews.text: ill be honest i only bought this product to try it but once i opened it, i could not stop eating it! This thing is delicious. If I only had this to eat for a day i would not be complaining because it tastes like dried sugar cookie dough with lemon juice mixed in.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin White

customer_reviews.title: Old product
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and there was a sticker covering up the Mfg Date. Bars were made Jan 2010 so I have already lost 3 years of the 5 year shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: Aguinaldo

customer_reviews.title: Havent tasted it yet
customer_reviews.text: A must have for an emergency kit I think. All reviews seem to indicate it tast satisfactory for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Raptor4

customer_reviews.title: No hechsher but ok
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it a little over a year ago (meant to do a review then but forgot). I bought it because I keep kosher. There was not hechsher on the product signifying that it was kosher. There was a halal marker though. We do not have the same dietary requirements. But I ate them anyway because I had no choice. They are edible, a bit lemony like one person said. A bit hard but not terribly so. They do crumble easily and the ants love to get into them.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin S Marsh, MS, CHt

customer_reviews.title: Best of all Emergency rations.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried them all while building a BoB. ER and Datrek just crumbled. This one had to best taste, held together and even is enriched with vitamins and minerals exceeding the RDA requirements. None of the others did. This will be my recommendation for my parents as well since they live in a hurricane zone. I am not the only one who feels this way... [...]
customer_reviews.author: Charles Burdick

customer_reviews.title: Correct me if I am wrong: 1. a ...
customer_reviews.text: Correct me if I am wrong: 1. a 4oz product is 28 x 4 = 112 grams. 2. Carbohydrate provides 4 calories per gram, protein provides 4 calories per gram, and fat provides 9 calories per gram. (from USDA.gov.) At 9 calories per gram of fat, this product would be 1008 calories IF the product were pure fat! So how does this have 1200 calories?
customer_reviews.author: CK in NH

product_meta.title: Mainstay 1200 Calorie Survival Bar
product_meta.description:
Mainstay Emergency Food Rations is the leader in competently designed food products for use in emergency/survival situations of many types. An Approved Military Ration, this 1200 Calorie meal in a bar is designed to be broken into three 400 calorie sections, which are pre-scored for measurement. That way, if it is a one day survival situation, you have three 400 calorie meals. But if it is longer, you can separate the bar into 400 calorie segments and make it last. The nutrition cannot be beat with Mainstay. This is no simple Powerbar, this is Designed for SURVIVAL, is non-thirst provoking and, Mainstay is the leader in relief effort food suppliers for global relief strategies.
All Mainstay Emergency Food Rations have a REAL five year shelf life, and are approved by the United States Coast Guard. 

Key Benefits:
5 year Shelf Life 
Non-Thirst Provoking
Withstands Temperatures of -40 F to 300 F (-40 C to 149 C) 
Ready to Eat: Each package contains 3 pre-measured 400 calorie meals. 
Individualized portions eliminate the messy breaking-up that occurs with other bars 
Allows for on-land emergency consumption in a high-stress active situation. 
Contains no cholesterol or tropical oils. 
Meets the US Coast Guard standards (160.046/23/0). 
New, modern packaging even meets the stringent guidelines set by the Department of Defense (SOLAS 74/83). 
Enriched with vitamins and minerals exceeding the RDA requirements. 
Pleasant lemon flavor which appeals to everyone. 
Mainstay is Kosher and it meets the dictates for Halal.
Made in the USA!
Get ready. Get Real. Get Mainstay!
Note: Food items are NOT returnable.
feature_bullets: Ready to Eat: Each package contains 3 pre-measured 400 calorie meals.
Enriched with vitamins and minerals exceeding the RDA requirements.
